properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 7:33PM CST until February 21 at 6:49AM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Flood
Warning for the following areas in Texas...

Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville Affecting Hunt County

South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan Affecting Hunt and Rockwall
Counties

The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan.
* from late tonight to Friday morning...Or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At 0645 PM Wednesday the stage was 5.62 feet.
* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river should rise above flood stage by early
Thursday morning and continue to rise to a crest near 16 feet by
Thursday afternoon. The river should fall back below flood stage
Thursday evening.
* At 15 feet, minor out of bank flooding will occur.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Stay tuned to NOAA All Hazards Radio for the latest river forecasts.
